author: Staff Reporter
text:
The police on Thursday arrested a 26-year-man old on charges of murdering his wife and burying the body in his house.

Anilkumar of Saragapalli village in Denkanikottai was working at a garment company in Bengaluru.

In 2013, he fell in love with Thiruveni (24) of Kodihalli in Bengaluru and married her. But after a month, due to difference of opinion, she went to her parents’ house and stayed there.

On February 18, Anilkumar called her over phone and asked her to come home. She informed her parents that she was going to Anilkumar’s house and left home.

Complaint

However, when Thiruveni’s brother Ravikumar called Anilkumar, he said he did not know anything about her. Ravikumar lodged a complaint with Jeevan Bhima Nagar police in Bengaluru that she was missing.

The police began inquiry. However, Anilkumar said that he had no idea about her.

Later, he admitted that he took her to his house in Saragapalli village and strangulated her and buried her in the house.

On Thursday, a team exhumed the body in the presence of Denkanikottai Tahsildar Govindan, DSP Soundarrajan and other officials.

The body was taken to Dharmapuri Medical College Hospital.

Later, the police arrested Anilkumar and took him to Bengaluru.
title: Man held for murdering wife
